1aKjeJBlVN_fR4o9jwurtA.text: High dive into frozen wavesWhere the past comes back to lifeFight fear for the selfish painAnd it's worth it every time at..POULET! - Zedd (clarity)My first meal when I arrived in Singapore! There was a picture of a huge chicken (their signature roasted chicken) outside the restaurant so that roped me in haha plus they have an open kitchen which is always appealing to the eye.The roasted chicken was just delicious! Nice and juicy; including corn on the cobb, potatoes, carrots, onions - casual french food done right. After not having fries for like two weeks, their fries were great :)Also ordered the 17 hour braised beef with mashed potatoes and this was not so good. The beef was tough and nothing compared to the chicken. Would not recommend ordering even though the presentation was nice.Get the chicken and you'll be happy - portions are a good size for french food so don't necessarily need to over order. Try their drinks - they look IG worthy!

TDDmn9cBuX6PB6scPPFnEw.text: This place was a good find!  Beware when ordering, sometimes the tablet doesn't register your order - Make sure you double check with the server to ensure it went through.  The half chicken is definitely worth the money and the sautéed mushrooms were amazing!

xoLn0ev8GoQPNPnK1zctfw.text: So been to several other outlets of this French sounding named restaurant. The first time years ago had lumps and lumps of un-melted soup granules ( like those you see in cup-a-soup). At least this shop served without those granules. Overall the soup was salty.The roasted chicken was tender and moist, but the white sauce was rather bland. Probably compared to the salty soup.Ordered side of curly fries and the buttered rice. The rice was good but at 2.50 for a small cup was rather expensive.The dessert creme bulee, the egg contents was like 2 egg tarts but sells for the price of a dozen.Overall rather expensive for a "cheap" French style food.BTW, found no reference of this restaurant chain in France.

photos.caption: Photo of Poulet - Singapore, Singapore. Creme brulee
Photo of Poulet - Singapore, Singapore. Warm peach tart with cold vanilla ice cream.
Photo of Poulet - Singapore, Singapore. Curly fries

SFEAOFGXlPZ5j4LXuA32tg.text: Wow, this is what makes a chicken a chicken!  haha, loved it since the first time I visited!The roast chicken is cooked well and the meat is still so tender, made so much tastier with their signature sauce!  Nom Nom Nom... I enjoyed it until the last bit.I tried their Roast Chicken with the signature Mushroom sauce, the special limited edition (during CNY) Mandarin Orange sauce, and their tangy sweet Cranberry sauce.  All three are AWESTRUCK-YUMMY!!!  And I figured that many others might have posted the photos of the shroom & cranberry sauce ones, I posted the photo of the limited edition Mandarin Orange sauce during my visit last time in CNY.  Oh...how I wish they will repeat this very special orderagain!  It was perfect!  XDBut hey, the other sauce and dish they have are exceptionally good as well, so I am still a fan of this French chicken!  Just one comment tho, they should give a bit more of those green leaves on the plate.  "More Green, please!"  Tried the Escargot, Mushroom soup, Sauted wild Mushroom too, and I enjoyed them as well.  And, Last but no least,  there's a reason why people say, "There's always room for DESSERT!" (ahem)  Yes.  ze' TIRAMISU.I'm done for. Love it.  Totally.  Wow. ahahahhaOh yes, and the Creme brulee, is ok.I choose T-I-R-A-M-I-S-U.  Yeah.Overall, worth a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Poulet - Singapore, Singapore. Past special limited edition Mandarin Orange Roast Chicken

Zd6PJeH-rlFHGZaJPuwvXw.text: My first time in Singapore and I was trying to eat locally, but after a few days I really needed something simple and familiar. Enter their base entree the roasted chicken with a mushroom sauce and steamed vegetables. The steamed veggies were just average but we're simple and just what I needed. The chicken was absolutely moist and the sauce was just right. I tried the "on special" lemon sauce on my second visit and it was just ok.The service was average but they always said "Bonjour" when a new group came in which was slightly annoying. Guess its there thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Poulet - Singapore, Singapore. Tiramisu! A little too wet for me.
Photo of Poulet - Singapore, Singapore. Half chicken traditional

C2fSYoOSZH9MlHJuweE80Q.text: Smoked duck salad with a tangy citrusy dressing was the highlight of our dishes ordered. Can't go much wrong with duck and orange!Lamb shank was alright. Meat was falling off the bone but wasn't flavoursome enough. Brown gravy that accompanied it was meh.Escargot - well cooked, not rubbery.

photos.caption: Photo of Poulet - Singapore, Singapore. pink grapefruit and elderflower soda cooler
Photo of Poulet - Singapore, Singapore. lamb shank
Photo of Poulet - Singapore, Singapore. escargot

lCAwtLMQFCwH4qmxJ1hUsA.text: After months of wishing and hankering I finally managed to get my bum down to the French seats of Poulet!Queue was long, journey was hard. We waited with rumbling stomachs, but Lady Luck was on our side and we got a seat (mainly because we came as a pair)As I sat and waited for my food, I had this sudden familiar feeling. Like I've been to this restaurant before.And yes I think I have. It feels like an upmarket kenny rogers or a French astons.Sitting next to the walkway didn't help too, as people kept gawking at my meal and probably judging me as I'm a messy eater. Note to self, sit in boothI chose the french onion soup and Poulet d cranberry - chicken doused in cranberry brown sauce and Dijon mustard. The french soup is better than the average soups you would meet. Nice and plenty of onions ...was I being too much as I  craved for melted cheese on top of my soup? And came the chicken.chicken was nice and tender, the gravy was the usual brown sauce with the cranberry.I'm not gonna rave much nor knock it down. Its alright.The price isn't extravagant. The chicken was good and enough for 2 (I ordered half mind you)I still think Charlie Ts chickens are better though.

photos.caption: Photo of Poulet - Singapore, Singapore. Rub a dub dub  4 croutons in a tub  French onion soup
Photo of Poulet - Singapore, Singapore. Poulet d cranberry

OYtNRgI6ablVxQt78cIlZQ.text: I should have not gone to this place with my French colleague.  Why?  She said, the food isn't authentic so in my head, I was eating a mediocre food and didn't think my brain worked well to ingest it well.  Alright, that's what I think so it won't sound as bad.  She and I order a bunch of things to share and it really wasn't all that great.  She eventually took me to her place and cooked the same dish.  Then I knew what it's supposed to really taste like.  Yeah, not going back again.

REugFsDT-3wT-fUMAaT01Q.text: Felt healthy eating the signature chicken dish. The white sauce complemented the half chicken really well. Came to Poulet with two other friends and we all ordered the same thing. I came late but my friends who were queuing waited an hour for the dinner. Fortunately, the dishes were served promptly after we were seated. For 15.80 a pop, this is really inexpensive French food. Will come again to try the other dishes!
